bioghist.p: Roger E. Nathan (d. 2005) of Woodstown, New Jersey, was a significant help to the Delaware, Maryland, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey boundary commissions during the 1980s and 1990s when the Delaware Boundary Commission was reestablishing Delaware's boundary monuments and signing new boundary agreements with neighboring states. Roger Nathan visited every monument and provided the commissions with photographic evidence and written reports on the condition of all 179 monuments. He was the author of East of the Mason-Dixon Line, A History of the Delaware Boundaries.

scopecontent.p: The Roger E. Nathan Papers consist of research materials related to the surveying of Delaware boundaries and the Mason-Dixon Line. Included among the papers are newspaper clippings, magazines, photocopies, a 1909 copy of the Report on the Resurvey of the Maryland-Pennsylvania Boundary, maps. note, and a foreword for a History of the Delaware Boundaries. The collection also includes some correspondence between Nathan and members of the State Boundary Commission and meeting minutes of the commission.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
